title: [KNOWN ISSUE] "We're unable to log you in because you may be offline"
body:
Hey everyone,

> **Update: 10:40am PDT** 
> 
> A fix was deployed, and the issue should now be resolved.  Best of luck on the rift!
----- 

> **Update: 9:40am PDT** 
> 
> Some players might instead see a** grayed Sign In** button.  The steps below should resolve that issue as well!

----
We're aware of an issue with patch 7.12 that results in this error showing. This will only happen if you relaunch the League Client while already in a game.

To avoid this issue - please do not relaunch your league client while you are in a game.

If you happen to crash out or run into this issue for some reason, there is a workaround you can use in the interim:

PC: 

* Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
* Open "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" with notepad
* Find the line:

   gameflow-patcher-lock:


* Delete this whole line
* Save the file, restart your LoL Client - and you should be able to log in again.


MAC:

1) Start and log onto League of Legends
2) Open Finder
3) Go to Applications
4) Right-click on League of Legends
5) Select Show Package Contents
6) Open Contents
7) Open LoL
8) Open Config
9) Locate LeagueClientSettings.yaml
10) Open it with a text editor and and find gameflow-patcher-lock
11) Delete the whole line
12) Save file and restart the client

----

We are currently investigating a code fix for this issue, however this should get you around this issue in the interim.

If you received a leaverbuster due to this problem please contact support explaining your issue for our support team to investigate.

then i will message you about it, you will apologize but won't resolve the issue and leave me with the fucking lobbies. AGAIN. 
SWEEEEEETTTTTTTT.

Are you ever going to turn off leaver buster when it is your fault? No? Do you ever wonder why people don't like you very much riot?
This dont work pls help me.
On my mac, the fix does not remain in the code even though I save the file. As soon as I open the client, the code is reverted

> [{quoted}](name=The Chosen Meep,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Tb1fUZFV,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2017-06-14T20:02:16.569+0000)
>
> On my mac, the fix does not remain in the code even though I save the file. As soon as I open the client, the code is reverted

Make sure the file isn't "Read-Only""

...it is not read-only. Let me be more specific. The changes are SAVED in the file. In other words, I can open the file again and the changes are made. It was edited, then it was saved and the file was no longer -Edited. 100% saved. UNTIL I open the client, upon which the changes are immediately reverted. I know they are reverted, because I  can see it happen for myself by looking at the file. Additionally, if I leave the Leagueclientsettings open (and SAVED with the line deletion), open the client, and attempt to save the file again (even though I made no changes) I get this message : The document "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" could not be saved. The file has been changed by another application.

Clearly something is changing the code when I open the client. And yes, I have saved the file, closed the file, then opened the client and the fix does not work.
This is happening to me as well.  Why would Riot suggest to us to do their coding for them? why?  They don't even give us a correct fix to do their work for them...

Hi The Chosen Meep,

Make sure no processes of LoL are running in the background. 

Easy way to do this, is to shut off your computer and then turn it back on. (preferred over just choosing the option "restart")

Edit the file immediately, before you open the client. Save and close- and then attempt to login, while launching the client through the primary folder (by default, C:\Riot Games\League of Legends) Launch "lol.launcher.admin" to run the League client. 

I did all of this, and I was experience the same issue you were- but I'm able to log in now and play.

Good luck.
Thank you, this worked for me.

Issue reopened in most recent patch--and I didn't relaunch while in a game.

Hey Guys!

Found this on an old forum and it worked for me:

Fix'd!

for anyone getting the same issue;

go to your C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\etc

open the 'hosts' file in a noteblock
Delete everything on the bottom (things with IP's)
save it
start LoL


GL
